descript.abstract: Routes of vessels providing scheduled, public car ferry service in the waters of Washington State are depicted as linear features. Known private, provincial, tribal and passenger-only ferry services are also shown.
descript.purpose: This data set is used as a reference layer for geographic information systems at the Washington State Department of Transportation. This layer is not intended for navigational purposes.

cntperp.cntorg: Transportation Data and GIS Office, Washington State Department of Transportation

idinfo.datacred: Allen Blake, Mark Bozanich, Derek Drake, Washington State Department of Transportation
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

citeinfo.origin: GIS/Cartography Section, Washington State Department of Transportation
citeinfo.title: Washington State Highways, 1998

attracc.attraccr: Attributes of ownership and State Route number are correct as of September 2013.

dataqual.complete: This data set represents every ferry route known to be operating in Washington State as of September, 2013. This includes ferry routes operated by the State of Washington, Canadian provinces, private entities and tribabl entities.

horizpa.horizpar: Positional accuracy has not been determined.

citeinfo.origin: Cartography Section, Washington State Department of Transportation
citeinfo.title: WSDOT 7.5 Minute Quadrangle
citeinfo.othercit: The WSDOT 7.5 Minute Quadrangle Series is based on 7.5 minute U.S. Geological Survey quadrangles. Selected features were digitized by WSDOT Cartography Section staff, including revisions compiled by the Cartography Section.

srcinfo.srccontr: The graphics and attributes depicting Washington State ferry routes.

procstep.procdesc: WSDOT Quad series design files (DGN files) including ferry routes were combined into a single file. This was converted to an Arc/Info coverage using Arc command "IGDSARC." The data was transformed to geographic coordinates using Arc commands "PROJECTDEFINE" and "PROJECT." Attributes of Ownership and State Route Number (if applicable) were added to the arc attribute table in ArcView, and the result converted to a shapefile.

cntperp.cntorg: Transportation Data and GIS Office, Washington State Department of Transportation

procstep.procdesc: The original Ferry Routes of Washington State dataset was updated based on information from Washington State Ferries and other sources.

cntperp.cntorg: Cartography and GIS Section, Geographic Services, The Washington State Department of Transportation

cntinfo.cntinst: Please call, email or write with questions.

procstep.procdesc: Some of the ferry routes depicted were updated with GPS data collected onboard the ferries.

cntperp.cntorg: Transportation Data and GIS Office, Washington State Department of Transportation

procstep.procdesc: Attributes where updated and the line segments were smoothed using the ArcGIS smooth tool with a tolerance of 10,000 feet.

cntperp.cntorg: Transportation Data and GIS Office, Washington State Department of Transportation

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypd: The path taken by a vessel transporting vehicles and passengers across bodies of water as a scheduled public, private, tribal, or provincial service.
enttyp.enttypds: Cartography and GIS Section, Geographic Services, The Washington State Department of Transportation

attr.attrdef: Ferry route (terminals locations between which the ferry travels on given route).

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The organization that operates the vessels on a ferry route (state=State of Washington; provincial=Canada; private=private entity; tribal bia=tribal entity).

attrdomv.udom: Values are phrases indicating generic ownership: "state," "county," "province of BC," "private," "federal," etc.

attr.attrdef: State Route number assigned by the Washington State Department of Transportation

overview.eaover: Ferry routes of Washington State are depicted as linear features with attributes identifying the operator and, if that is the Washington State Deptartment of Transportation, what State Route Number is assigned to the ferry route.
overview.eadetcit: State=ferry is operated by the State of Washington Private=ferry is operated by a private entity Provincial=ferry is operated by a Canadian province Tribal BIA=ferry is operated by a tribal entity

cntorgp.cntorg: Washington State Department of Transportation, Office of Information Technology
